title: Nic’s Roasted Vegetable and Quinoa Salad
ingredients:
1 zucchini, cut in 1cm thick slices 
1 small butternut pumpkin, peeled and in 2cm chunks
1 red capsicum, 2cm pieces
1 eggplant, cut in 2cm cubes
¼ cup olive oil
2 cups quinoa (usually just the white one but looks even better if add red and/or black too) 
1½ cups vegetable or chicken stock
1 cup (100g) oven roasted tomatoes 
4 cups baby spinach leaves
100g feta crumbled
method: Drizzle olive oil over veggies and then spread between two baking trays and roast for thirty minutes or until tender and golden.
Meanwhile, rinse the quinoa in a sieve under cold water until water runs clear.
Put in saucepan with stock and bring to boil over high heat.
Reduce to low, cover and simmer for ten minutes or until water absorbed.
Remove from heat and keep covered for further ten minutes, then fluff with fork and allow to cool.
Transfer to a large bowl with veggies from oven, tomatoes, spinach and feta.
Toss to combine, then serve immediately.
Some fresh mint from the garden added a nice fresh zap.
